Don't worry,.
I've got you covered!
You can still access your phone's content by connecting it to your PC.
You can still access and control your phone using a PC.
You can still access and control your phone using a PC with a feature called "USB Debugging" or "Android Debug Bridge (ADB)".
You can still access your phone's content and even control it using your PC.

Here are some step-by-step instructions to help you connect your phone to a PC and view its screen:

**Method 1: Using Android Debug Bridge (ADB)**

**Requirements:**

* A Windows,ous computer with a USB port (this method doesn't work on Mac)
* Your Android phone with a working USB port (even if the screen is dead)
* Android SDK Platform Tools installed on your PC (download from <https://developer.android.com/studio/releases/platform-tools>)
* A compatible USB cable

**Steps:**

1.
**Enable Developer Options**: On your phone, go to Settings > About Phone/Device > Tap "Build Number" several times until you see "Developer options enabled".

Enable Developer Options on your Android phone:
	* Go to Settings > About Phone/Device > Build Number/Tap several times until Developer Options are enabled.
* Go back to Settings > Developer Options > Enable USB Debugging.
2. Connect your phone to your PC using a USB cable.
2. Connect your phone to the PC using a USB cable.
